sentences.english: They are like junkies, with unkempt hair and beards, bad skin and poor appetites.
sentences.chinese: 跟毒癮者般，頭髮鬍子不修，皮膚蒼白，缺乏食慾。

sentences.english: Day. 1725】She used to be a heroin addict, but now she is clean.
sentences.chinese: 她過去是一位海洛因毒癮患者，但是她現在戒毒了。

sentences.english: He is a drug addict, hooked on a mix of cocaine and meperidine.
sentences.chinese: 是一個被古柯鹼和呱替啶混合劑控制的毒癮患者。
診所使服用海洛因的人戒去毒癮。

sentences.english: Many people the hysteria of that film and the quaintness of the way that it depicts drug addiction.
sentences.chinese: 很多人沉緬於片中歇斯底里和它描述毒癮的奇特手法。

sentences.english: One thing I haven't yet tried is a digital detox.
sentences.chinese: 有一件事我還沒試過，就是戒掉數字毒癮。

sentences.english: He said Cameron had battled with drugs since age 13.
sentences.chinese: 他說卡梅隆從13歲起就開始與毒癮做鬥爭。

sentences.english: At this time, began to twitch zhang zhijian, is addiction again.
sentences.chinese: 此時，張志堅開始抽搐，是毒癮又犯了。

sentences.english: You will be part of a community of individuals all trying to get help for their addictions.
sentences.chinese: 你將是一個社區的個人所有想幫助他們的毒癮。

sentences.english: You don’t see people in this age group stealing a car to get their next dose.
sentences.chinese: 你不會看到這一年齡的人有偷車賣錢來滿足毒癮的。

sentences.english: His mother said he was mentally unstable because of drug addiction.
sentences.chinese: 他的母親則說，他是因染上毒癮導致精神狀況不穩定。

sentences.english: He has also fought a long battle with addictions to drink and prescription drugs.
sentences.chinese: 長期以來，他還在與酗酒習慣和處方藥毒癮作抗爭。

sentences.english: Even the little boy has a monkey on his back.
sentences.chinese: 甚至這個小男孩也染上了毒癮。

sentences.english: In the past, drug addiction has been up, three inside the room used easily with a needle, which control who is.
sentences.chinese: 以前毒癮上來了，順手抄起針管就用，哪管是誰的。

sentences.english: Dirty place, filly people and most of them addicts.
sentences.chinese: 這地方真骯髒，年輕女孩們裏大部分都有毒癮。

sentences.english: “How do we unlink from our addiction to fossil fuels?” (Economy)
sentences.chinese: 我們怎樣才能擺脫對化石燃料的毒癮式依賴？

definition: lit. as if sitting on pins and needles (idiom)/fig. to be in an uncomfortable situation
to gesticulate/to make lively gestures (while talking)/also written 比手劃腳|比手划脚
without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
unable to turn around a hopeless situation (idiom)/to fail to save the situation
loss of love/breakup of a relationship
